intro: Triumfetta trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed spiderling, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves with three distinct lobes and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various environmental conditions, contributing to its widespread distribution.
